ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ إِذَا ٱلشَّمْسُ كُوِّرَتْ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When the sun is compacted in blackness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: WHEN THE SUN is folded up,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: When the sun shall be folded up,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (On the day) when the sun is made to cease shining,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: When the sunlight is rolled up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: When the sun shall be darkened,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When the sun is folded up,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: When the sun shall be wound round,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When the sun is wound up,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When the sun (with its spacious light) is folded up;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: When the sun Kuwwirat (wound round and lost its light and is overthrown).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When the sun is rolled up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:1] When the sun is folded away, enfolded and stripped of its light,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said regarding the interpretation of Allah's saying (When the sun is overthrown): '(When the sun is overthrown) it is also said that He says: when the sun is turned around as one turns a turban and is then thrown into the veil of light; it is also said this means: when the light of the sun vanishes.
